intro: Zaga latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf zaga, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Zaga latifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
